title_desc: U.S. Fed chair rules out negative interest rates even as Trump trumpets them. U.S. president goes negative on Jerome Powell for rejection of below-zero interest rates
Interest rates are plunging — so why aren't mortgage rates?. Bond yields and central bank rates have never been lower, but not all the savings are filtering down
Why high interest rates were a problem for '80s renters, too. They didn't have mortgages, but their landlords did
Canada's big banks cut credit card interest rates to ease coronavirus impact. Big Six will temporarily reduce credit card interest rates amid COVID-19 pandemic
Bank of Canada makes another emergency cut to interest rate. Bank has made an emergency rate cut twice in 2 weeks in response to damage of COVID-19 pandemic
Bank of Canada holds interest rates steady. Central bank holds the overnight rate steady at 1.75%
Bank of Canada makes emergency interest rate cut. Move comes on top of previous 50-point cut last week
Bank of Canada holds interest rates steady. Holds benchmark interest rate at 1.75 per cent
U.S. Federal Reserve cuts benchmark interest rate by half-point to offset coronavirus impact. Rate cut is biggest since 2008 financial crisis
Slashed interest rates, getting a piece of the electric car pie, and a happy 'Jobs Friday' to all!. Plus how do Canadian events plan ahead in the wake of COVID-19 fears?
Interest rates made home buyers look beyond their comfort zone in 1979. Interest rate of almost 15 per cent drove property seekers to less desirable districts
U.S. Federal Reserve cuts interest rates for 3rd time this year. The target range for the federal funds is now 1.5 to 1.75%
Bank of Canada holds interest rate at 1.75%, wary of global slowdown. Central bank says outlook for global economy 'has weakened further' since July
Fed takes action to control short-term interest rates. U.S. Federal Reserve Bank of New York carried out $53 billion US in transactions known as repurchase agreement
Court fight over pawned accordion highlights how many brokers' interest rates are illegal. Agassiz pawnbrokers dinged over 25% monthly loan rate they say is standard in B.C.
Bank of Canada resists pressure to cut its interest rate — for now. Central bank leaves key rate at 1.75%, but appears ready to adjust lower
Bank of Canada unlikely to follow any Fed interest rate cut. U.S. central bank expected to drop interbank lending rate by 25 basis points
Bank of Canada holds interest rate steady at 1.75%, citing trade tensions. Outlook clouded by trade, central bank says, lowering global growth forecast
Bank of Canada holds key interest rate steady at 1.75%. Decision in line with what economists were expecting
U.S. central bank cuts interest rate again — but split on what to do next. Federal Reserve moving to stimulate economy as trade fears mount
Bank of Canada holds rate steady at 0.25% and hints it has no plans to go any lower. Bank expects economic activity to slow by as much as 30% from end of 2019
Lump sum credit on electricity bills as soon as July. Low oil prices have left $50M surplus in rate stabilization fund
Group calls on P.E.I. to reduce highest allowable payday loan rates in country. In midst of economic crisis, worries high cost of borrowing could further sink households into debt
Barber who sought N.S. COVID-19 loan calls program a 'blunder'. Halifax barber Eoin Wright says interest rate too high, payback start date too soon
U.S. Federal Reserve leaves rates near zero as COVID-19 savages U.S. economy. Economists forecast sharpest downturn in U.S. history this quarter
U.S. Federal Reserve slashes rate to near 0 in effort to offset COVID-19 impact. Fed also said it will drop some bank requirements in order to encourage lending
Interest rate cut for COVID-19 is like surgery with a club: Don Pittis. Cheap money is a blunt instrument that won't fix specific economic problems caused by coronavirus outbreak
Bank of Canada follows U.S. with half-point rate cut to soften blow of coronavirus. Bank rate reduction comes amid economic concerns over coronavirus outbreak
How the coronavirus has thrown interest rate plans out the window. 40 banks around the world have already cut interest rates — and Canada could be next
As COVID-19 bailouts pile up, Canadians ask for relief on credit card rates. Credit cards have much higher interest rates than other forms of debt and so far, are drawing less scrutiny
Port Hawkesbury Paper gets 4-year power rate discount. Mill to get power at rate 25% cheaper than other customers are charged
Manitobans would temporarily lose public hearings on Hydro rates under new law. Province says moving to multi-year rate hearings, instead of yearly, would save Manitobans' money
More rate cuts possible if coronavirus impact worsens, Poloz says. Investors think it is a near certainty that bank will cut again next month
Here's more info on the N.W.T. government's low-interest loan program for businesses. Loan program part of territory's $13.2M financial relief package
Canada's unemployment rate climbs to 5.9%. Regionally, Quebec suffered the biggest decline in jobs from the previous month
Fed's Powell sees steady growth, signals pause in rate cuts. Powell's testimony comes a day after Trump attacked the Fed for not cutting interest rates further
Why homeowners ran 'the Marathon of Despair' in 1981. Protest against high interest rates also involved burning a miniature house
Alberta government looking at low interest credit for struggling oil and gas companies. Jason Kenney says he's spoken with federal government about contributing funds

Province says new law will benefit drivers' rates by keeping government hands off ICBC profits. B.C. NDP will introduce a law this week designed to keep any future surpluses within ICBC to benefit drivers
Canadian economy cooled off in 3rd quarter, Statistics Canada says. Bank of Canada expected to hold line on interest rates next week
U.S. Fed says monetary policy will remain 'non-political' after Trump-Powell meeting. Trump summons Fed chairman to White House to discuss economy, interest rates
U.S. central bank cuts interest rate for 1st time since 2008. Move trims U.S. rate by quarter point to 2.25%, closer to Bank of Canada's
Hydro rates rising 2.5% for most customers. Additional revenue will fund ongoing capital construction
NB Power rate used to justify smart meters 'low,' says expert. Expert calculated 1 per cent swing worth $7M
U.S. Federal Reserve holds rates steady, expects moderate growth next year. Fed policy makers signalled borrowing costs likely to remain unchanged indefinitely
'Avalanche' of personal debt has doubled N.L. insolvency rates since 2014, insider says. Not just the oil bust leading to bankruptcies
Why it was hard to sell or buy a home in Vancouver in 1981. Interest rates were the stumbling point
Bell scales back rural internet plans after CRTC decision on rates. Bell will nix 200,000 customers from expansion, Rogers says it is reviewing options
Canadian inflation 1.9% in September as lower gas prices keep rate steady. Rate held at 1.9% for second straight month, close to Bank of Canada's ideal target of 2%
More Fed cuts expected to push Canadian interest rates lower: Don Pittis. Watch for effects of shrinking global economy to hit Canada as well
British budget confronts challenges of coronavirus, post-Brexit economy. New finance minister's budget preceded by half-point Bank of England rate cut
The pros and cons for Canadian cities interested in being hubs for fan-free NHL games. Vancouver, Edmonton, Toronto among Canadian cities to show interest in possible plan to salvage season
Retailers foresee holiday joy — even as Poloz looks to hold line on rates: Don Pittis. While the world cuts interest rates, the Bank of Canada likely won't if we keep shopping
NB Power plan to remove Joi Scientific spending from rate increase an empty gesture, says expert. Utility opened EUB hearings with surprise move to lower requested rate increase to 1.9%
OPINION | For Alberta, the potential of geothermal energy is clear, if it's done right. Without right strategy, development of this low-carbon resource will not be realized
Erdogan fires Turkey's central banker, creating jitters over currency. Turkey's president wanted to lower interest rates, currently at 24%, but banker refused
Ball, O'Regan to make 'significant announcement' on Monday after rate mitigation talks over weekend. 'The ball is in the government's court, so let's hear from Premier Ball,' says Ches Crosbie
Why worries about the coronavirus are pushing mortgage rates down. Fear has pushed investors to buy up bonds, which is causing cheaper borrowing for home buyers
CAQ passes bill on Hydro-Québec rates by invoking closure. Opposition parties united against the bill, saying it won't save customers money

Free mortgages and bond yields turned upside down: trade war impacts veer toward the wacky. From inverted bond yields to negative interest rates, the world's economy is headed into uncharted territory
European Central Bank keeps rates low as new president takes helm. Decision follows a similar one by the U.S. Federal Reserve
Cheaper energy pulls Canada's inflation rate down to 2% in June. If energy is stripped out, cost of living increased at a 2.6% annual pace last month
As the U.S. economy tilts toward concern, Canada's is on the upswing: Don Pittis. Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell holds interest rates steady, but opens the door to future cuts
Powell hints Federal Reserve will cut rates if needed over trade wars. Expectations are rising that the Fed will cut rates at least once and possibly twice before year's end
Questionable Florida investment by NB Power in spotlight at rate hearing. Utility and province spent $13M on licensing rights for technology claiming to generate hydrogen from seawater
European Central Bank holds rates, but paves way for possible stimulus. More stimulus could be coming soon to support an economy weakening in the face of global trade tensions
Canada added 54,000 jobs in September, StatsCan says. Unemployment rate drops to 5.5%, in the last job report before Canadians head to the polls
Inflation's return would upend consumer and market strategies: Don Pittis. Experts warn record spending and printing money could lead to post-COVID price rises
Bank of Canada may cut rates to aid economy sickened by COVID-19: Don Pittis. Central bank action may be part of a co-ordinated G7 plan as recommended by OECD
Calgary pulling together list of projects for life after pandemic. Nenshi says governments are interested in creating jobs, getting economy moving when crisis is done
Once considered industry friendly, New Brunswick's auto insurance regulator is pushing back. Wawanesa is asking for two rate increases in 2020, but will have to get by NB's Insurance Board
U.S. jobs growth strong, casting doubt on anticipated Fed rate cut. Stocks slide as jobs report indicates continuing growth in U.S. economy
Average residential customer to save $127 this year on natural gas. Discontinued furnace replacement program 'a large influence' in overall rate decrease: Public Utilities Board
Name calling and market pressure may curb U.S. Fed's independence: Don Pittis. With few signs of recession, could Jerome  Powell leave rates unchanged even if he wanted to?
Dow at record above 27,000 as U.S. rate cuts look likely. Powell's testimony to Congress indicates key rate could be cut in July
Gatineau cyclists ticketed at much higher rate. Ottawa cyclists fined less, but far outnumber Gatineau counterparts
3 P.E.I. MLAs list tax debt in conflict of interest documents. P.E.I.'s transportation minister says he paid off his debt Monday
U.S. Fed's Jerome Powell urges Congress to tackle growing budget deficit. Comment comes a day after Powell said interest rates will likely remain unchanged
City to look at new approach to creating affordable housing. The plan would offer interest-free loans to developers
MPI vows to cut auto insurance rates, argues shift to online sales is a must. Average cost of insurance for private passenger vehicles would decrease 0.9%
S&P 500 hits record high on hopes of trade deal, rate cut. Technology stocks also helped push benchmark index to all-time high and Nasdaq close to record
Rebooted rate design could spell extreme price changes for NB Power customers. Consultants' report to EUB suggests public needs to be on board for changes to work
Markets up sharply, rebounding from 7-day, coronavirus-driven decline. Rally comes amid hope central banks will cut rates to shore up economies
Employment held steady in October, Statistics Canada says. Economy lost 1,800 jobs, a number low enough that unemployment rate is unchanged
Ottawa, N.L. agree to cut financing costs of Muskrat Falls, but how isn't yet clear. Ball and O'Regan say deal would keep hydro rates stable, details yet to be settled
P.E.I. to save on debt with improved bond rating. Higher bond rating means lower interest rates on government debt
'Pretty cheap money': Canadian mortgage rates falling to their lowest level in 2 years. Fixed and variable loans have gotten cheaper because costs for lenders are down too
Interest in off-grid homes growing, but mortgages haven't kept pace. People who work in the solar power industry report growing interest in self-sufficient homes
Canada's economy lost 2,200 jobs last month. Jobless rate ticks up to 5.5%, although past year has seen 421,000 jobs added
Houses in New Brunswick selling at unusually fast rate. Increase in home sales backed by record-setting month in May
Staring down Muskrat's 'extraordinary' pressure on N.L. electricity rates. Public hearings commence in St. John's as utility regulator eyes options for mitigation
How fast is your cost of living going up? Play our interactive game. Try your hand at guessing inflation rates in various categories
How measles outbreak spurred renewed interest in national vaccine registry. Each province and territory has own immunization schedule, recording system
'Desperate need for improvements' to mental health services in northern Sask.: auditor. Suicide rates in northwestern Sask. exceed provincial average by 50%, auditor's report says
Bond rating agency likes what it sees in P.E.I. budget. A higher rating would mean government would pay less interest on debt
Can the Tories double the rate of job creation in Manitoba?. PCs promise 40,000 new jobs in 4 years ... that's more new jobs than Manitoba added in the previous 9 years
The cost of dying: How a spike in cremation rates is changing the funeral industry. Cost, choice and weakening religious ties are behind the increase in cremation rates
Wellington-Halton Hills candidates grilled on gas tax, climate change, housing strategy by region. Surveys are found on section of region's website called 'advocating for a strong Halton'
St. John's budget passes unanimously with no increase in residential, commercial tax rates. Improvements to public transit one of main budget focuses
After meeting with PM, Dwight Ball says he expects federal Muskrat Falls solution by January. N.L. premier reiterated his confidence that the federal government will help with rate mitigation
City of Thunder Bay proposes municipal tax levy increase of $6M. Four per cent increase to water and wastewater rates proposed in budget
U.S. corporate leaders swing left to fix 'frayed' American dream: Don Pittis. But critics call 11th-hour conversion a smokescreen to block new rules and taxes
Democracy activists in Calgary on mission to demystify the voting process. New Canadians and young people not participating at same rate, says Democratic Engagement Exchange founder
Big spending increases and a modest residential property tax hike in Montreal's 2020 budget. Opposition accuses mayor of driving up debt, leaving city vulnerable if interest rates go up
Federal NDP Leader Jagmeet Singh first to respond to Premier Dwight Ball. Promises of rate mitigation, a fixed link and more
Why it's time to end corporate welfare for Canada's fossil fuel industry. Subsidies undermine our economy, add to the tax burden, and hinder innovation
Let's put the idea of garbage in the trash. Celebrate the recycling bin instead of putting it in a dark corner, columnists say
OPP complaint a 'witch hunt,' Blackridge Strategy says. The OPP is now looking into whether it should investigate the PR firm for Municipal Elections Act violations
Doug Ford's dumpster fire explains why Ontario tolerates years of Liberal mismanagement: Robyn Urback. The same sorts of scandals, plus austerity measures, lead to an unhappy province
Is this game over for Ottawa's baseball stadium?. Current deal with Champions not in city's financial interests, says councillor
Police watchdog seeking witnesses to cruiser crash that injured 6. General patrol unit vehicle, driving at 'high rate of speed,' was responding to 'suspicious male'
Leaders talk financial relief, but Trudeau still quizzed over blackface scandal. Trudeau announces plan to cut taxes, cellphone rates
Beyond impeachment: How the hearings might impact the 2020 election. 'My guess is it's going to be a distant memory,' says one Republican strategist

Laurentian student government president warns of substantial funding cuts to ancillary programs. SGA president projects that Laurentian will have opt out rates up to five times higher than other schools
CBE trustees release document to combat budget 'misconceptions'. Ministry official says CBE demonstrates 'systemic inability to prioritize their students'
